subject: p14794396
History: Year old man with dyspnea on exertion and low sats. , r/o pneumonitis.
Impression: There is interval progression in upper lobe opacities, bilateral, with is similar areas of distribution but involving more substantial amount of lung parenchyma. Heart size and mediastinum are unchanged. The differential diagnosis might include cryptogenic organizing pneumonia as previously suggested as well as potentially sarcoidosis. Correlation with tissue diagnosis is recommended.
